name: Ning Leng's GitHub page
body:
## Software

### EBSeq
EBSeq is an R package for identifying differentially expressed genes and isoforms using RNA-seq data. EBSeq provides improved power and well-controlled FDR in isoform analysis by accounting for varying uncertainty across different isoform groups. It accommodates
experiments with two or more conditions. EBSeq graphical user interface and Galaxy wrapper are also available on EBSeq page.

[EBSeq page](https://www.biostat.wisc.edu/~kendzior/EBSEQ/)

[EBSeq on GitHub](https://github.com/lengning/EBSeq)

### EBSeqHMM
EBSeqHMM is an R package for detecting expression changes in RNA-seq experiments with ordered conditions (e.g. time or spatial course). EBSeqHMM incorporates a hidden markov component to accommodate dependence between adjacent time points (positions).
 
[EBSeqHMM page](https://www.biostat.wisc.edu/~kendzior/EBSEQHMM/)

[EBSeqHMM on GitHub](https://github.com/lengning/EBSeqHMM)

### OEFinder
Identify genes with artificial expression trends in single cell RNA-seq data (ordering effect genes) - with GUI

[OEFinder on GitHub](https://github.com/lengning/OEFinder)

### Oscope
Identify oscillatory genes in unsynchronized single cell RNA-seq data

[Oscope page](https://www.biostat.wisc.edu/~kendzior/OSCOPE/)

### Gene set enrichment analysis GUI

[on GitHub](https://github.com/lengning/Enrichment_shiny)

### SCPattern
Identify expression changes in single cell experiment with two or more conditions

[SCPattern on GitHub](https://github.com/lengning/SCPattern)

## Publications

### Selected Publications
-	N. Leng*, L. Chu*, C. Barry, Y. Li, J. Choi, X. Li, P. Jiang, R. Stewart, J.A. Thomson, and C. Kendziorski, Oscope identifies oscillatory genes in unsynchronized single cell RNA-seq. Nature Methods, 2015 (Press in Science Daily, Health Canal, Morningstar, Sleep Review, Phys.org, etc.)
-	N. Leng, Y. Li, B.E. Mcintosh, B. K. Nguyen, B. Duffin, S. Tian, J. A. Thomson, C. Dewey, R. Stewart, and C. Kendziorski. EBSeq-HMM: A Bayesian approach for identifying gene-expression changes in ordered RNA-seq experiments. Bioinformatics, 2015
-	N. Leng, J.A. Dawson, J.A. Thomson, V. Ruotti, A.I. Rissman, B.M.G. Smits, J.D. Haag, M.N. Gould, R.M. Stewart, and C. Kendziorski. EBSeq: An empirical Bayes hierarchical model for inference in RNA-seq experiments. Bioinformatics, 2013 (Featured highly-cited article from Bioinformatics in 2014)
-	N. Leng, J. Choi, L. Chu, J. Thomson, C. Kendziorski, R. Stewart, OEFinder: A user interface to identify and visualize ordering effects in single cell RNA-seq data. Under review.

###Other Publications

-	H.C. St. John, K.A. Bishop, M.B. Meyer, N.A. Benkusky, N. Leng, C. Kendziorski, L. Bonewald and J.W. Pike, The Osteoblast to Osteocyte Transition: Epigenetic Changes and Response to the Vitamin D3 Hormone. Molecular Endocrinology, 2014
-	C. Yao, N. Leng, K. Weigel, K.E. Lee, C.D. Engelman and K.J. Meyers. Prediction of Genetic Contributions to Complex Traits using Whole Genome Sequencing Data. BMC Proceedings, 2014
-	R. Stewart, C.A. Rasc√≥n, S. Tian, J. Nie, M.D. Probasco, J.M. Bolin, H. Ardalani, R.J. Wagner, L.F. Chu, C. Barry, N. Leng, S. Sengupta, M. Volkmer, B. Habermann, E.M. Tanaka, J.A. Thomson, C.N. Dewey. Comparative RNA-seq Analysis in the Unsequenced Axolotl: The Oncogene Burst Highlights Early Gene Expression in the Blastema. Plos Computational Biology, 2013
-	B.M. G. Smits, J.D. Haag, A.I. Rissman, D. Sharma, A. Tran, A.A. Schoenborn, R.C. Baird, D.S. Peifer, D.Q. Leinweber, M.J. Muelbl, M.L. Amanda, M.R. Eichelberg, N. Leng, C. Kendziorski, M.C. John, P.A. Powers, C.M. Alexander, M.N. Gould. The Gene Desert Mammary Carcinoma Susceptibility Locus Mcs1a Regulates Nr2f1 Modifying Mammary Epithelial Cell Differentiation and Proliferation. Plos Genetics, 2013
